content:
(a) In either case, one gets two magnets, each with a north and south pole.

(b) No force if the field is uniform.

The iron nail experiences a non-uniform field due to the bar magnet.

There is induced magnetic moment in the nail, therefore, it experiences both force and torque.

The net force is attractive because the induced south pole (say) in the nail is closer to the north pole of magnet than induced north pole.
summary: Two magnets, each with a north and south pole, can induce magnetic moments in iron nails. However, the iron nail experiences a non-uniform field due to the bar magnet and experiences both force and torque because there is induced magnetic moment which is closer to the north pole of magnet.
hypothetical_questions: What happens when a magnet is placed near an iron nail?
What is the direction of the force exerted by a magnet on a nail?
